akn:section.akn:heading: Technical data under contracts for commercial items: presumption of development exclusively at priva

akn:content.akn:p:
§ 3784. Technical data under contracts for commercial items: presumption of development exclusively at private expense In the case of a challenge to a use or release restriction that is asserted with respect to technical data of a contractor or subcontractor under a contract for commercial products, the contracting officer shall presume that the contractor or subcontractor has justified the restriction on the basis that the commercial product was developed exclusively at private expense, whether or not the contractor or subcontractor submits a justification in response to the notice provided pursuant to section 3782(c) of this title. In such a case, the challenge to the use or release restriction may be sustained only if information provided by the Department of Defense demonstrates that the commercial product was not developed exclusively at private expense. (Added and amended Pub. L. 116–283, div. A, title XVIII, § 1833(g), (k), Jan. 1, 2021, 134 Stat. 4231, 4233.)
Editorial Notes Codification The text of subsec. (f) of section 2321 of this title, which was transferred to this section and amended by Pub. L. 116–283, § 1833(k), was based on Pub. L. 103–355, title VIII, § 8106(b)(2), Oct. 13, 1994, 108 Stat. 3394; Pub. L. 109–364, div. A, title VIII, § 802(b), Oct. 17, 2006, 120 Stat. 2313; Pub. L. 110–181, div. A, title VIII, § 815(a)(2), Jan. 28, 2008, 122 Stat. 223; Pub. L. 113–291, div. A, title X, § 1071(a)(5), Dec. 19, 2014, 128 Stat. 3504; Pub. L. 114–92, div. A, title VIII, § 813(a), Nov. 25, 2015, 129 Stat. 891; Pub. L. 115–232, div. A, title VIII, §§ 836(c)(8), 865, Aug. 13, 2018, 132 Stat. 1866, 1901, as amended by Pub. L. 116–283, div. A, title X, § 1081(d)(4)(B)(ii), Jan. 1, 2021, 134 Stat. 3874; Pub. L. 117–81, div. A, title X, § 1081(a)(28), Dec. 27, 2021, 135 Stat. 1921.
